title: Type t-shirts
content:
Hello.  
I’m looking to buy interesting t-shirts that have gourgous type printed on them.  
I would love to see what you guys found online or even your own stuff !

Cheers!

 [‹ giving up garamond.](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704192527/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43490 "Go to previous forum topic") [Vyaz Ligatures ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704192527/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43534 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Tatumanu

comments.content:
Because I’m a trendy type nerd, I love Experimental Jetset’s famous Beatles T-shirt

[http://www.experimentaljetset.nl/archive/tshirtism\_intro.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704192527/http:/www.experimentaljetset.nl/archive/tshirtism_intro.html "http://www.experimentaljetset.nl/archive/tshirtism\_intro.html")

Equally as trendy for type nerds:  
 [http://www.veer.com/products/merchdetail.aspx?image=VPR0001260&WT.ac=mer...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704192527/http:/www.veer.com/products/merchdetail.aspx?image=VPR0001260&WT.ac=merch.080301.6.img.kernzipup "http://www.veer.com/products/merchdetail.aspx?image=VPR0001260&WT.ac=merch.080301.6.img.kernzipup")

Yeah i have seen the beatles t-shirt on the helvetica documentary, but that kerning sweater really is a type nerd gear.  
Just to remember ill have to be kerning pairs for the next few weeks ... arghh  
Thanks chipman
I hate Veer. They just have to tempt me with overpriced display faces I won’t ever use, and worse, overpriced t-shirts and hoodies that I probably will.

Threadless has some nice type tees: [http://www.threadless.com/catalog/line,typetees](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704192527/http:/www.threadless.com/catalog/line,typetees "http://www.threadless.com/catalog/line,typetees") and this special Lorem Ipsum one: [http://www.threadless.com/product/1144/Ketchup\_And\_Mustard](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704192527/http:/www.threadless.com/product/1144/Ketchup_And_Mustard "http://www.threadless.com/product/1144/Ketchup\_And\_Mustard")

But they’re on sale, so I don’t know how long they’ll be available.

by the way, that ketchup and mustard shirt is by [http://www.alextrochut.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704192527/http:/www.alextrochut.com/ "http://www.alextrochut.com/") he also has some really sweet designs other than shirts.
@Simon: Is that the t-shirt or the wearer? ;^) JUST KIDDING!

Thanks for reminding me about Threadless!

-=®=-

Not gorgeous type, but since we’re talking type shirts:

[http://www.zazzle.com/Campbell\_Graphics/product/235675163417830668](http://web.archive.org/web/20080704192527/http:/www.zazzle.com/Campbell_Graphics/product/235675163417830668)

Jason C

<cite>Not gorgeous type, but since we’re talking type shirts.</cite>

Grotesque Accidents... clever.
